Detailed Description

This class represents a TinyJava method call expression.

A nethod call expression is represented by:

  • class name, if the referenced method is a static method in a different class
  • method name; a pointer to the symbol table ENTRY for the name may also be included.
  • call arguments

ENTRY should be defined as a macro, and its value should be a class, which is the root of the symbol table entry hierarchy. Its default value is Entry. The macro should be defined at the beginning of the header file Ast.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MethodCallExpression::MethodCallExpression ( int  lno,
const char *  className,
const char *  methodName,
std::vector< Expression * > *  args 
)

Create a new MethodCallExpression object. The default type of this Expression is set to AstNode::TINT.

Parameters:
lno a source line number with this method call expression
className a string representing the class name with the method (if thie is a qualified name)
methodName a string representing the method name
args a std::vector of Expression pointers, each representing an argument expression
Exceptions:
AstException if the methodName is NULL

Expression* MethodCallExpression::getArgument ( int  pos  )  [inline]

Return the specific argument Expression

Parameters:
pos the argument position; the first argument is at position 0
Returns:
a pointer to the Expression representing the requested argument of this method call
Exceptions:
AstException if the requested argument does not exist, i.e. if the method call has no arguments, or if the pos value is outside of the argument number range
